definitions.definition: a member of an ancient people living in what is now Israel and Palestine and, according to biblical tradition, descended from the patriarch Jacob, grandson of Abraham. After the Exodus ( circa  1300 BC) they established the kingdoms of Israel and Judah, and their scriptures and traditions form the basis of the Jewish religion.
old-fashioned and sometimes offensive term for Jew.
the Semitic language of the Hebrews, in its ancient or modern form.
of the Hebrews or the Jews.
